title: Recommendations on new geometric typefaces with a good amount of weights
content:
Hello,

If anyone can recommend some new typefaces that are pretty geometric and mechanical in nature which also have a good variety of weights.

Thanks,

Dan
author: Dan Newcomer

comments.content:
How "mechanical"? Can you give an example?

Ideas from vaguely geometric to very strict:  
 [Graphik](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417044812/http:/typographica.org/001138.php)  
 [Geogrotesque](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417044812/http:/www.emtype.net/geogrotesque_02.php)  
 [FF Cube](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417044812/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=FF%20Cube%20OT)  
 [Purista](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417044812/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/suitcase/purista_family/)  
 [Stratum](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417044812/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/process/stratum_2_ot/)  
 [FF QType](http://web.archive.org/web/20150417044812/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=FF%20Qtype%20OT)
